summary: An internal FBI email from July 20, 2019, discussing the status of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, including coordination with SDNY on forfeiture, digital evidence analysis (CART), and financial analysis. It details investigative priorities such as obtaining a search warrant for Epstein's island, potential child pornography charges, victim services for 59 identified victims, and specific evidentiary questions regarding seized images and binders.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE, the central figure in the investigation concerning evidence from his island, residence, and alleged crimes involving minors.

events.title: FBI Investigation Status Update
events.description: Internal FBI email outlines the status of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, including coordination with SDNY on forfeiture, CART examination of digital devices, financial analysis, and planning for a potential search warrant of Epstein's island.

keyFacts: The FBI and SDNY were coordinating the investigation, with the FBI leading forfeiture and digital evidence (CART) examination, while SDNY used an outside vendor for financial analysis.
Investigators were assessing probable cause for a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's island, based on victim statements, open-source reporting, and seized images from New York.
The FBI was exploring a potential child pornography (CP) charge based on seized images that may represent a 'lascivious display of the genitals,' alongside evidence of Epstein's conduct with minors.
The investigation had identified 59 victims, and victim services were a high priority, with plans to ensure a victim specialist (VS) was present at every victim interview.

Specific evidentiary questions were raised regarding the number of potential CP images and the contents of binders found in a closet, including whether they contained names of Florida-based victims and images of Epstein touching minors' breasts.
